metadata.name: Disable DHCP Client in ifcfg
metadata.description:
For each interface on the system (e.g. eth0), edit /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-interface and make the following changes:
  • Correct the BOOTPROTO line to read: 
    BOOTPROTO=none
  • Add or correct the following lines, substituting the appropriate values based on your site's addressing scheme: 
    NETMASK=255.255.255.0
IPADDR=192.168.1.2
GATEWAY=192.168.1.1
metadata.rationale:
DHCP relies on trusting the local network. If the local network is not trusted,
then it should not be used.  However, the automatic configuration provided by
DHCP is commonly used and the alternative, manual configuration, presents an
unacceptable burden in many circumstances.

manual_remediation:
For each interface on the system (e.g. eth0), edit /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-interface and make the following changes:

  • Add or correct the following lines, substituting the appropriate values based on your site's addressing scheme: 
    NETMASK=255.255.255.0
IPADDR=192.168.1.2
GATEWAY=192.168.1.1
